channel.title: How do i make a ::commands
channel.description: id like to know how to make a ::commands so it will popup on a scroll with all of the commands thnx

item.title: How do i make a ::commands
item.dc:creator: @lildude783 lildude783
item.description:
@lildude783 wrote:

… ya wut the top guy said… but some information…

When you do a command a packet is sent… you can use that packet to your advangtage… like when you talk with :: in front of it it sends the packet ## (i havent done 317 packets in a while) commands.java is where that packet is read.

You start with a String… sooo somewhere there it sould say…

String command = blahblahblah.addString();

then you get to the part they’re talking about with command.equalsIgnoreCase(“COMMAND”)

to get what YOU want… you will need 3 things… a command name (::commands), an interface (preferrebly an interface like a quest scroll with words on it), and Strings… (use the sendString methods)

Simple…

So get your command written

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) {

}

then set your voids inbetween the brackets.

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { player.getActionSender().sendInterface(278); // Using 508 Code becuz i can't remember 317, sorry player.getActionSender().sendString("YOUR-SERVERS NAME Commands", 278, 1);// again, 508 method.. player.getActionSender().sendString(" These commands must be followed! They are..", 278, 2);// still, 508 method.. }
and so on…

good luck to you… hope your server works

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make a ::commands
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

It also depends on what you want the command to do. To start a command you can either start it with:

if(command.startsWith("text here")) {

or

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("text here")) {

The first option allows the user to type something after the name of the command. For example: For the ::pickup command you have to type stuff after it. With the second option you have to type the exact name of the command and it ignores the case (upper or lower).
then you can also apart from sendQuest can do:

addItem(####,####); sendMessage("Message Here); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; ^^^^^^^^^^^^ The two teleport commands go together and where it says absX or absY you can type the X or Y coordinate pEmote = ####;
There are more that i can’t think of right now but you get the picture right? Make sure you you have a completed command that it has a closing bracket. This is an example of a command:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("gold")) { addItem(995,999999999); sendMessage("You got money!"); }

I hope that helped!

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make a ::commands
item.dc:creator: @blitz_ags blitz ags
item.description:
@blitz_ags wrote:

Just edit name and commands

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands") && (playerRights >= 0)) { String name = command.substring(5); sendQuest("@gre@Divine Paradise's Players Commands Guide.", 8144); //Title clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("", 8146); sendQuest("@blu@Players Commands", 8147); sendQuest("", 8148); sendQuest("::pure", 8149); sendQuest("::donorpoints", 8150); sendQuest("::lock", 8151); sendQuest("::unlock", 8152); sendQuest("::staffcommands", 8153); sendQuest("::donatorcommands", 8154); sendQuest("::fcguide", 8155); sendQuest("::players", 8156); sendQuest("::max", 8157); sendQuest("::alchs", 8158); sendQuest("::mypks", 8159); sendQuest("::changepassword", 8160); sendQuest("::yell", 8161); sendQuest("::rules", 8162); sendQuest("", 8163); sendQuest("", 8164); sendQuest("", 8165); sendQuest("", 8166); sendQuest("", 8167); sendQuest("", 8168); sendQuest("", 8169); sendQuest("", 8170); sendQuest("", 8171); sendQuest("", 8172); sendQuest("", 8173); sendQuest("", 8174); sendQuest("", 8175); sendQuest("", 8176); sendQuest("", 8177); sendQuest("", 8178); sendQuest("", 8179); sendQuest("", 8180); sendQuest("", 8181); sendQuest("", 8182); sendQuest("", 8183); sendQuest("", 8184); sendQuest("", 8185); sendQuest("", 8186); sendQuest("", 8187); sendQuest("", 8188); sendQuest("", 8189); sendQuest("", 8190); sendQuest("", 8191); sendQuest("", 8192); sendQuest("", 8193); sendQuest("", 8194); sendQuest("", 8195); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }
